# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, the function can be written as follows:
```Julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase string and strip leading/trailing whitespaces.
    col = lowercase(strip(col))
    
    # Replace spaces or hyphens with underscores.
    return replace(col, r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
You can then call the function on a column name: `clean_column("My Column")` which will return "my_column".
